nl.idgis.geoide.commons.http.client

Interface HttpRequest

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHttpRequest

    public interface HttpRequest
    The HttpRequest interface describes the parameters for a request that is to be peformed on HttpClient. Each HttpClient interface can use a specific implementation of HttpRequest, created indirectly by using HttpClient.request().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  HttpRequest.Method
      Enum containing all supported HTTP request methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> getBody()
      Returns the body of the request in the form of a reactive streams publisher of ByteStrings.
      Map<String,List<String>> getHeaders()
      Returns the headers for the request, or an empty map if the request has no headers.
      HttpRequest.Method getMethod()
      Returns the HTTP method to be used for this request.
      Map<String,List<String>> getParameters()
      Returns the query parameters for the request, or an empty map if the request has no parameters.
      long getTimeoutInMillis()
      Returns the request timeout in milliseconds.
      String getUrl()
      Returns the URL for this request.
      boolean isFollowRedirects()
      Returns true if redirects should be followed when executing the request.

    • Method Detail

      • getMethod

        HttpRequest.Method getMethod()
        Returns the HTTP method to be used for this request. A method must always be set and should default to GET.
        Returns:
        The HTTP method for this request.

      • getUrl

        String getUrl()
        Returns the URL for this request. An URL must always be set.
        Returns:
        The URL for this request.

      • getTimeoutInMillis

        long getTimeoutInMillis()
        Returns the request timeout in milliseconds. This should default to a HttpClient implementation specific value and can be overriden using a HttpRequestBuilder.
        Returns:
        The request timeout in milliseconds.

      • isFollowRedirects

        boolean isFollowRedirects()
        Returns true if redirects should be followed when executing the request. Since this is a potentially dangerous operation, the default set by HttpClient implementations should be false.
        Returns:
        True if redirects should be followed, false otherwise.

      • getParameters

        Map<String,List<String>> getParameters()
        Returns the query parameters for the request, or an empty map if the request has no parameters. Since the order of parameters can be significant at the receiving end it is recommended that HttpClient implementations use a linked map (or similar) for parameters.
        Returns:
        A map containing query parameters, or an empty map if the request has no parameters. Cannot return null.

      • getHeaders

        Map<String,List<String>> getHeaders()
        Returns the headers for the request, or an empty map if the request has no headers. Since the order of headers can be significant at the receiving end it is recommended that HttpClient implementations use a linked map (or similar) for headers.
        Returns:
        A map containing headers, or an empty map if the request has no headers. Cannot return null.

      • getBody

        org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> getBody()
        Returns the body of the request in the form of a reactive streams publisher of ByteStrings. Can return null if the request has no body (this is the case with most GET requests for example).
        Returns:
        A publisher for the request body, or null if the request has no body.
